root.name: Protocols
root.description: Design your own quantification protocol, visually. No programming required! Protocols can be shared and re-used straight from the Icy website.
root.author: adufour - Alexandre Dufour
root.changelog:
- Version 3.0.3.0 Date 2018-02-27 17:46:32
Added Protocols.getInstance() method to retrieve Protocols main instance (can be useful !)
- Version 3.0.2.0 Date 2018-02-12 17:40:55
Re introduced java 7 compatibility
- Version 3.0.1.0 Date 2017-02-24 16:59:15
Fixed an issue in headless mode on Linux
- Version 3.0.0.0 Date 2017-02-06 12:22:13
New: command-line support! Protocols can now be run directly from the command line, and arguments can be passed over to input blocks inside your protocols
- Version 2.4.3.0 Date 2016-06-13 12:03:54
- Version 2.4.2.0 Date 2016-05-27 10:58:08
Fixed a bug that occurred when installing missing blocks on-the-fly while opening a protocol
- Version 2.4.1.0 Date 2015-12-17 23:32:24
Fixed a graphical glitch when painting exposed links
- Version 2.4.0.0 Date 2015-12-17 23:22:37
* Fixed the copy-paste system * Only a single Protocol can be used
- Version 2.3.1.0 Date 2015-04-30 17:49:49
Fixed Block ID display for 3-digit numbers (yes, someone did break the century!)
- Version 2.3.0.0 Date 2015-03-18 00:11:34
New: execution log panel next to each protocol (BETA)
- Version 2.2.4.0 Date 2015-01-29 16:18:34
* Updated to SDK 4.4.5 * Fixed display issues when loading protocols and drawing links
- Version 2.2.3.0 Date 2015-01-23 18:05:17
Fixed an issue causing embedded block not to allow their variables to be exposed
- Version 2.2.2.0 Date 2015-01-23 17:53:27
Attempting to fix a bug that is hard to find and reproduce...
- Version 2.2.1.0 Date 2014-12-19 13:05:08
* Upgraded to SDK v.2.2.1 * "Run until here" and "ID" buttons are back due to popular demand * "Run until here" option now guarantees block highest priority
- Version 2.2.0.0 Date 2014-12-11 13:31:09
* Updated to SDK v.4.4 * NEW: Protocols can now be opened directly by dropping ".protocol" files into Icy (just like images) * Revamped graphical user interface with all-in-one menu and status notification icon * Blocks can be removed using the backspace key * Loop: option to stop on first error
- Version 2.1.6.0 Date 2014-11-22 20:17:54
* Updated to Protocols engine 4.3.0.0 * The block search panel now includes developer information in the documentation panel.
- Version 2.1.5.0 Date 2014-10-06 19:59:19
Fixed an issue when closing the Protocols window
- Version 2.1.4.0 Date 2014-10-05 18:18:16
Fixed issue causing blocks not to collapse properly
- Version 2.1.3.0 Date 2014-09-15 21:57:07
Bug fixes on protocol loading
- Version 2.1.2.0 Date 2014-09-12 17:40:05
Fixed drag'n'drop for ".protocol" files
- Version 2.1.1.0 Date 2014-08-04 17:21:52
Improved error handling, and fixed a few GUI glitches
- Version 2.1.0.0 Date 2014-07-24 19:16:43
* Major code refactoring: better separation between the engine (Protocols SDK) and the graphical user interface (Protocols) * Fixed memory leak * Improved error and message handling * Fixed drag'n'drop operations not working on some systems
- Version 2.0.6.0 Date 2014-07-23 00:05:09
Fixed the "cancel" button when closing the window
- Version 2.0.5.0 Date 2014-06-18 14:02:41
Fixed a copy/paste issue within inner workflows
- Version 2.0.4.0 Date 2014-06-17 18:33:02
Fixed an issue when copying links that contain an exposed variable (ignored for now)
- Version 2.0.3.0 Date 2014-06-17 14:45:14
Improved graphical layout & block descriptions
- Version 2.0.2.0 Date 2014-05-21 19:15:51
Update by Ludovic Laborde
* Updated to Icy 1.5 * Fixed drag'n'drop issue from the search bar
- Version 2.0.1.0 Date 2014-05-19 12:49:39
Fixed bug when closing a protocol and saving it (would not re-open it afterwards)
- Version 2.0.0.1 Date 2014-05-18 20:03:52
Updated jar file (line numbers did not match in bug reports)
- Version 2.0.0.0 Date 2014-05-16 21:21:18
Update by Ludovic Laborde
Integrated search bar: find your blocks fast and easily, insert them with a simple drag'n'drop operation.
- Version 1.7.5.0 Date 2014-05-12 20:36:21
Fixed a bug causing the window closing operation not allowing to be cancelled
- Version 1.7.4.0 Date 2014-04-27 15:45:29
Fixed the "save as" button
- Version 1.7.3.0 Date 2014-04-24 18:45:50
* Removed "insert block" button from main interface (only accessible through right-click for the time being) * Adjusted tool bar and tool tips to be more explicit
- Version 1.7.2.2 Date 2014-01-27 13:56:44
Customize error message when blocks cannot be installed via Icy4Eclipse
- Version 1.7.2.1 Date 2013-11-15 21:44:58
Updated to Icy 1.4.2.0 (removed deprecated calls), no logic change
- Version 1.7.2.0 Date 2013-10-28 11:35:56
* Reload the interface when a protocol is opened from disk *after* a plugin reload event * Describe the loading process with an announcement frame
- Version 1.7.1.0 Date 2013-10-14 17:33:05
Online protocols are now downloaded to a new "protocols" subfolder inside Icy, so you can carry them with you at all times!
- Version 1.7.0.0 Date 2013-10-12 18:09:36
Fixed multiple reloading issues: * The Protocols interface now reloads only when a protocol requires the installation of one or more new plugins. * Reloading now correctly preserves and reloads previous state. No more data loss
- Version 1.6.0.0 Date 2013-07-12 13:46:25
New option to clean protocol results to save memory
- Version 1.5.8.0 Date 2013-07-12 13:33:36
Screenshots saved along protocols now have an extra "_protocols" suffix to avoid name clashes
- Version 1.5.7.0 Date 2013-05-27 18:05:30
* Fixed an issue causing all online protocols appearing in a search result to be downloaded locally (even if never used). * Selected protocols from the search bar are now downloaded to the default protocols folder
- Version 1.5.6.0 Date 2013-05-26 19:30:43
Upgraded online protocol provider to the new kernel (should reduce server load)
- Version 1.5.5.0 Date 2013-05-18 23:39:41
Updated to Icy 1.3.5.0 (removed deprecation calls)
- Version 1.5.4.0 Date 2013-03-25 09:13:05
* Images dropped in protocols are now opened in Icy * Fixed an issue causing Protocols to reload properly when the class loader changes
- Version 1.5.3.0 Date 2013-03-22 14:35:36
Fixed an issue causing Protocols to fail opening properly after Icy restarts
- Version 1.5.2.0 Date 2013-03-12 20:34:09
Show an error message when opening a wrong XML file (rather than a bug report)
- Version 1.5.1.0 Date 2013-03-08 15:05:08
Updated to Blocks v.2.4
- Version 1.5.0.0 Date 2013-02-28 19:58:29
Protocols can now be searched and loaded directly from Icy's search bar!
- Version 1.4.3.0 Date 2013-01-07 13:05:25
Fixed a memory leak (caused by the file drag'n'drop mechanism)
- Version 1.4.2.0 Date 2012-12-07 17:42:47
Fixed memory leaks
- Version 1.4.1.0 Date 2012-11-07 17:16:58
* NEW: the snapshot button has been removed from the interface; the snapshot is always saved alongside the xml file * Fixed minor drag'n'drop issue causing the interface border to disappear (the border is now no longer highlighted when dropping file(s))
- Version 1.4.0.0 Date 2012-11-07 16:53:00
* NEW: Drag protocols directly into the Protocols interface * Minor interface fixes when quitting Icy
- Version 1.3.2.0 Date 2012-10-16 15:01:01
Fixed loading bug (from 1.3.1.0)
- Version 1.3.1.0 Date 2012-10-15 16:57:28
Static access to the main frame (allows launching a protocol from outside the interface)
- Version 1.3.0.0 Date 2012-09-27 15:50:55
* Fixed support for live plugin loading/saving * Status bar indicates loading status
- Version 1.2.0.0 Date 2012-09-26 16:56:17
Resubmit jar file
- Version 1.1.2.3 Date 2012-09-26 16:20:58
* Updated to Blocks 1.8.0.0 * New: the Protocols interface automatically saves its state and reloads when plugins are reloaded
- Version 1.1.2.2 Date 2012-09-06 16:28:32
Updated to Blocks 1.7
- Version 1.1.2.1 Date 2012-09-03 14:58:47
Improved error reporting (no logic change)
- Version 1.1.2.0 Date 2012-08-30 15:45:47
Updated to Blocks engine 1.6: ability to stop a running protocol
- Version 1.1.1.0 Date 2012-08-07 18:52:01
Updated to Blocks 1.5.0.0
- Version 1.1.0.0 Date 2012-08-03 12:03:49
Fixed bug reporting issue (bugs were never sent by email)
- Version 1.0.2.0 Date 2012-07-11 18:07:43
Snapshot feature restricts to the contents of the workflow
- Version 1.0.1.0 Date 2012-07-09 17:48:34
- Improved file saving dialog (overwrite prompt, auto-add extension) - Fixed a few memory leaks
- Version 1.0.0.0 Date 2012-07-06 12:06:58
First officially stable release ! - Workflows can now be embedded into loops (useful for batch processing)
- Version 0.9.9.2 Date 2012-07-04 11:51:35
Updated to Blocks 0.12
- Version 0.9.9.1 Date 2012-07-03 18:52:50
Release Candidate 1: - Updated to Blocks 0.11.0.0 - New status bar for each protocol - Removed "colorize links" button (true by default) - Collapse feature de-activated (will be improved in a later release)
- Version 0.0.3.0 Date 2012-06-29 19:07:58
* Improved interface labels and access to menus and blocks. * added second status bar for future use to monitor a running process
- Version 0.0.2.0 Date 2012-06-28 17:17:11
Added snapshot feature
- Version 0.0.1.0 Date 2012-06-22 14:11:11
